Articles.Content:
Report From The Kerbal Intelligence Division

Jebediah was sent on a mission to destroy the rival space agency's north pole station, however mid flight his rocket was shot down and he was captured, he is now imprisoned by the polar kerbals, bill bob and gungun kerman are now enroute to rescue their commandant
My Jebediah Kerman is currently on his way home to KSC, having been successfully recovered from a Duna-Ike flyby mission...

Jeb is currently stranded aboard MonkeyLauncher Alpha in solar orbit in the vicinity of Eve, after having accidentally slingshotted out of the Kerbin system. With no fuel he is patiently awaiting a rescue mission which isn't even close to being on the books.
He is trying to steal a spot on EVERY rocket I build ... feels like each time I change even a tiny little thing he takes a seat on my rocket. I contiously have to remove him from them.
My original three guys are sitting comfortably in a space station at 90km, where no harm will (hopefully) come to them .
My Jeb is currently in Muner Orbit, he has ran out of electric charge because the kerbal engineers haven't researched solar panels yet....

Currently, Jebediah is on EVA in a 5 million km orbit around the Sun because I needed some footage for a video.

No, I have no idea how he'll get home, but he seems to be enjoying himself just fine where he is.
My Jeb is doing research on Eve with his brand new science rover. He might be there for a while though...

Update on S.R.B's foremost test pilot/explorer Jebediah Kerman.

After spending almost four days on EVA just several meters of his painfully inaccessible craft, Jebediah was rescued by automated retrieval vessel. His first words after entering the capsule were: "Where's the toilet?". Followed by: "Yes! Snacks!". After taking care of his most pressing needs Jeb decided to NOT return emptyhanded. True to his outstanding reputation he spent couple of hours more repeating the same experiments as he did on his first, crippled ship. Only after depleting the Mystery Goo to the last clump, and filling memory bank to the last sector Jeb performed braking burn, which brought him back on Kerbin...smack in the middle of the Great Desert.

"Mmmm. Warm and sunny. Niiiice."

"But Jeb?" Asked baffled CapCom Bill. "You could've landed next to KSP - just in time for dinner. Now you'll have to wait couple of hours for retrieval team. Why did you insisted on landing in the Desert?"

"Easy, old chap. I've never seen a cactus"

Totally worth it

M.I.A. - Missing In Action

Last transmission was recorded on a decent to Duna 18:00 Kerbin time
In Astronaut Complex, having a donut. I hope.

I take Bill, Bob, and Jeb and personally walk them to safety to watch all my failures from the VAB Helipad as their colleagues die all around them. I think I saw Jeb cry once... Once. He's likely dead on the inside after seeing so many fellow Kerbalnauts fail to achieve orbit or get off the runway and either crash off the side exploding into a puff of lifeless air, slam back into the runway smearing themselves on the pavement, or takeoff and disintegrate as they collide with the ocean. KSP is a gruesome place...
Six feet under.
On the surface of Ike, waiting to do science and return to his home world.

After about 20 missions, from first orbit to a duna landing (in career mode), mine is on vacation on an Minmus rover... only problem is that he'll need to call for a rescue mission because his lander has no parashutes.... or batteries / solar panels

Six feet under.

Down Under

(M.A.W.)
In minmus, in a very basic rocket, looking at the crystals and not believing that Minmus wasn't made of mint ice cream after all

stuck in orbit around the mun, and has been for 2 years and 164 days,

poor guy, I'll get him, eventually.
Currently in a 300km orbit above Kerbin, aboard my Space Shuttle.
Stranded on Laythe...
Curently He Is In A Workin Space Station Orbiting Duna. I Used It To Send Some Probes To Jool, And A Lander With Bob, Bill And Another Guy that I Forgot The Name, To Laythe.
Currently cruising on the mun in his Rampart Rover. He's travelled 100km so far, on his quest to take eva reports and surface samples from all of the mun's major craters.
Floating in a lander around Kerbin while I make a multi part interstellar ship.
At KSC, showing his badassery :

Safely confined......I mean, ensconced in a padded room....I mean, luxury suite at the space center where he can't mess up...I mean, miss all the launches.

You think I'm gonna let that maniac anywhere near my spacecraft? Those things are expensive dangit!!
